module, involvement, role, class, activity
This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module to record a class of involvement in an activity.
The nature of an involvement in an individual activity may be specified by indicating a class of involvement in which it is a member.
The relationship 'stress analysis performer' between:
the class of person 'stress engineer'; and
the class of activity 'stress analysis',
is a Class of involvement in activity.
The cardinality for this relationship is follows:
a stress engineer may be involved in zero, one or many stress analysis activities;
a stress analysis activity has one or many stress engineers involved in it.
The involvement of John Doe, who is a stress engineer at Joe Bloggs and Co., and the stress analysis of part XYZ_123 carried out on 2001-05-02, is classified as 'stress analysis performer'.
The cardinality for the relationship is within the scope of the Cardinality_of_relationship application module.
a mapping between a class of activity and a class of product, document, organization, or person that indicates the nature of an involvement in an activity.
individual involvment in activity; Individual involvement in activity is within the scope of the Individual_involvement_in_activity application module.
membership of a class of involvement in activity. Membership of a class of involvement in activity is within the scope of the Activity_structure_and_classification application module.
The Class_of_involvement_in_activity UoF identifies a class of involvement in an activity and defines the classes of thing that play a role.
